Talk1100:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:TalkPositive>Tell me, buddy. Are you interested in
those <clr:0000>unusual animals <clr:ffff>after all?
Talk1020:
<sp:3:0:2:0801>Those are a species of animal that few
have ever seen called <clr:0000>Dondons<clr:ffff>. They
were discovered in this area.
A young woman on the opposite bank
has been taking care of them. She really
knows her stuff.
If you'd like to learn more, buddy,
I'd suggest that you talk to her.
Talk1021:
<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:LaughS_00>Oh,<sp:5:0:0> so you're curious about them too?
Then you must have a keen mind.
Talk1125_01:
<sp:3:0:2:0b01><snd:SurpriseM_01>Wait...<sp:5:0:0> Is that a giant white stallion you
have with you, buddy?

<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:LaughS_00>That's as impressive as a Dondon!<sp:5:0:0> Thanks
for showing me something so rare.
Talk1010:
<sp:3:0:2:0b00><snd:SurpriseL_00>Oh!<sp:5:0:0> Hi there.<sp:0:4:0>Didn't really notice you walk up, buddy.
I've been looking across the way there.

<sp:3:0:2:0801>I wonder, are you curious about the <clr:0000>
unusual animals<clr:ffff> over there too?
Talk1130_01:
<sp:3:0:2:0000><snd:TalkPositive>There's a lot of rain ahead.<sp:5:0:0> Don't tough it
out. Just rest at the stable.
Near0002: I'd like to touch a Dondon.
Talk1000:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00><snd:Sad_01>I'd like to get a close look at the animals
over there. But darn it all. They run off
when people get close.
Talk1130:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:SurpriseS>Hello, hello... Like being out in the rain
like this?
Talk1001:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Think_00>Fascinating creatures...<sp:5:0:0> Stocky build,
bulky animals, all of them...

What I wouldn't give to get a closer look.<sp:5:0:0>
Better yet, to touch one.
Talk1131:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:TalkPositive>Oh,<sp:5:0:0> are you out and about in this
weather? You watch yourself, buddy.<sp:5:0:0>
Lightning! And more lightning!
Talk1132:
<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:Greeting>Hi there.<sp:5:0:0> Where are you off to so early?<sp:5:1:0>
As for me, I'm thinking of getting a
closer look at the Dondons.
Talk1120:
<sp:3:0:2:0701><snd:Happy>A young woman on the opposite bank has
been taking care of them. She knows her
stuff, all right. She could tell you more.
Talk1133:
<sp:3:0:2:0100><snd:TalkPositive>The Dondons are on the opposite bank.
You should go see them if you're curious.
Talk1131_01:
<sp:3:0:2:0000><snd:Happy>It's rough if lightning strikes any of your
metallic possessions. Don't risk it. Just
rest at the stable.
Talk1134:
<sp:3:0:2:0300><snd:Ease>You've got to excuse me. My old bones
need a rest.
Talk1131_02:
<sp:3:0:2:0000><snd:Happy>It can be hard to see through all of the
trees around here, and at night, it's even
trickier. Be careful as you travel.
Talk1110:
<sp:3:0:2:0801>Those are a new species of animal that
few have ever seen called <clr:0000>Dondons<clr:ffff>. They
were discovered in this area.
Talk1137:
<sp:3:0:2:0a00><snd:Sad>Darn it all. I can't see a single one of
those Dondons in the rain...
Talk1030:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Happy>I'd like to get close enough to touch one.
If only once!
Talk1125:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Notice_00>Speaking of new kinds of creatures...<sp:0:4:0>A pair of fellows visited the stable
recently and said they're searching
for some <clr:0000>unusual creatures<clr:ffff>.
<sp:3:0:2:0c00><snd:Think_01>They're seeking a <clr:0000>giant white stallion<clr:ffff> and
nothing less than the <clr:0000>horse god<clr:ffff>.

Unusual, indeed. That stallion sounds
much larger than a horse. And that god is
surely much greater than a creature!
<sp:3:0:2:0000><snd:Happy_00>Those two headed west of here, toward
the <clr:0000>Lake of the Horse God<clr:ffff>. You could go
talk to them if this sounds intriguing.
Talk1138:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Think>Lightning, lightning! The dragon god must
be angry today!
